result.execSummary:
The defendant James Christopher Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, fees, and $300 buy money--work out payment plan with agent
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
Def not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing, or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Maintain a stable residence
Maintain full time employment
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare
Def must give DNA sample 1-17-17

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

discharge - regular
